items.name: Revolver
items.description: A handheld firearm with a revolving cylinder containing multiple chambers and at least one barrel for firing.

items.name: Rifle
items.description: A long-barreled firearm designed for accurate shooting at long ranges.

items.name: Shotgun
items.description: A firearm typically used for hunting and sport shooting, firing a spread of small pellets or a single slug.

items.name: Saddle
items.description: A supportive structure for a rider or other load, fastened to an animal's back.

items.name: Horse
items.description: A large, hoofed mammal commonly used for transportation and labor in the Old West.

items.name: Wagon
items.description: A four-wheeled vehicle used for transporting goods or people, typically pulled by horses.

items.name: Pickaxe
items.description: A hand tool with a hard head attached perpendicular to the handle, used for breaking up rocks or soil.

items.name: Lasso
items.description: A long, coiled rope with a loop at one end, used for roping cattle or other livestock.

items.name: Whiskey Bottle
items.description: A container for holding whiskey, a popular alcoholic beverage in the Old West.

items.name: Gold Pan
items.description: A shallow metal pan used for washing gold-bearing soil or gravel in search of gold.

items.name: Saddlebags
items.description: Bags attached to a saddle for carrying personal belongings or supplies while riding.

items.name: Spurs
items.description: Metal devices with a small spike or rotating disk worn on the heel of a boot, used to urge a horse forward.

items.name: Pocket Watch
items.description: A small watch designed to be carried in a pocket, typically with a chain attached.

items.name: Canteen
items.description: A container used to carry drinking water, typically made of metal or leather.

items.name: Poker Chips
items.description: Small, disc-shaped objects used to represent money or bets in poker and other gambling games.
